body: How are you loading the wallets?
File -> Open Wallet -> 8204388-wallet.dat then File -> Open Wallet -> 1352491-wallet.dat.  Click the second one (which is a duplicate of the first wallet) and the GUI crashes.

Here's a backtrace.

Is this a bug report or feature request? Be reminded that Bitcoin Core can't open two wallets with the same file id at the same time.
@MarcoFalke Perhaps I'm misunderstanding something here but if the user is able to achieve a core dump from the UI then we're not handling this error condition in a very user friendly way?
It appears this is only an issue with the GUI, not with the daemon

No, it also affects the daemon. For instance, create copies of the default wallet and then
```
src/bitcoind -regtest -debug -wallet=wallet2.dat -wallet=wallet3.dat
```
I think `CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile` should catch the exception, WDYT?

BTW, the exception comes from `CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile -> BerkeleyBatch::BerkeleyBatch -> CheckUniqueFileid`.

Turns out that catching the exception is not enough. For instance, with the following:
```diff
diff --git a/src/wallet/wallet.cpp b/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
index cf88ab846..648b0b0ea 100644
--- a/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
+++ b/src/wallet/wallet.cpp
@@ -4266,7 +4266,12 @@ std::shared_ptr<CWallet> CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile(interfaces::Chain& chain,
     // TODO: Can't use std::make_shared because we need a custom deleter but
     // should be possible to use std::allocate_shared.
     std::shared_ptr<CWallet> walletInstance(new CWallet(&chain, location, WalletDatabase::Create(location.GetPath())), ReleaseWallet);
-    DBErrors nLoadWalletRet = walletInstance->LoadWallet(fFirstRun);
+    DBErrors nLoadWalletRet;
+    try {
+        nLoadWalletRet = walletInstance->LoadWallet(fFirstRun);
+    } catch (const std::runtime_error& e) {
+        return nullptr;
+    }
     if (nLoadWalletRet != DBErrors::LOAD_OK)
     {
         if (nLoadWalletRet == DBErrors::CORRUPT) {
```
And then
```
src/bitcoind -regtest -wallet=wallet2.dat

src/bitcoin-cli -regtest loadwallet wallet3.dat
error code: -4
error message:
Wallet loading failed.
```
However:
```
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z ThreadRPCServer method=loadwallet user=__cookie__
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z Using BerkeleyDB version Berkeley DB 4.8.30: (April  9, 2010)
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z Using wallet /Users/joao/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets/wallet3.dat
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z init message: Loading wallet...
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z [wallet3.dat] Releasing wallet
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: [/Users/joao/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/regtest/wallets] Flush(false)
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flushing wallet2.dat (refcount = 0)...
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet2.dat checkpoint
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet2.dat detach
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: wallet2.dat closed
2019-09-06T14:56:36Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Flush: Flush(false) took              30ms
```
So I think it messes up `wallet2.dat`.
FWIW I ran across this issue today while testing #15204 (thanks @promag for the link here): https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15204#issuecomment-533076341.

Was able to reproduce with 0.19.0.rc1 on Windows. Used same method as OP.
In my debug.log, no info was given. When the error occurs, this is what I see (the debug log stops after this):

```
2019-10-14T11:05:21Z init message: Loading wallet ...
2019-10-14T11:05:21Z BerkeleyEnvironment::Open: LogDir=C:\Users\usr\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\wallets\1\database ErrorFile=C:\Users\usr\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\wallets\1\db.log
2019-10-14T11:05:27Z Loading addresses from DNS seed dnsseed.emzy.de


```

A window pops up which tells a bit more about the error.
![Screenshot_115](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42591821/66743863-6b8f2c80-ee6a-11e9-9fc7-924015c0a728.png)

Hi,

First, I am not sure about the state of this bug and the PR related to it: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16923 , so, please, give me a hint if I am talking about things that I should not have touched.

Anyway, I just *experimented* a bit, and would like to offer an alternative solution that uses the **Hash160** Function to create hashes of given wallet files **before** the **LoadWallet** in *load.cpp* kicks in.

This way every duplicate wallet file will be ignored, and logged.

As shown here:

![duplicate_wallet](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/brakmic/bazaar/master/images/random/ignore_duplicate_wallet.png)

Of course, it doesn't have to be that way, as we could instead raise some error or warning message for the user. I am not sure which way is better, but regarding the fact that I don't even know, if this experiment makes any sense, I'd rather avoid writing about the respective pros & cons.

Here the link of the diff in my repo: https://github.com/brakmic/bitcoin/commit/e7606c8761f8e6c0381c7a5e46d9704ed71ce7e4

There are two new functions, **GetWalletHash** and **IsUniqueWalletHash** as well as a **vector<uint160>** for accepted wallet hashes. This vector gets cleared whenever **UnloadWallets** is called. 

Regards,

@brakmic I don't think that will work, as it will only detect exactly identical wallet files, but not separate snapshots of the same wallet database at different points in time (i.e. it won't detect loading a wallet and a restored earlier backup of the same wallet simultaneously).
